title: Ticket #3359: Fix dagman_fullremove test on FreeBSD
description: TJ asked me to look at job_dagman_fullremove test, as it seems to fail consistently on FreeBSD7.
remarks:
2012-Dec-17 15:41:18 by nwp:
Rumor says we don't care about FreeBSD anymore. FW meeting 17 December 2012 says rumor is true. Abandoning.

2012-Dec-26 12:16:10 by nwp:
TJ says rumor is now false. Restoring ticket status to active.

2012-Dec-31 09:35:49 by nwp:
Finally got a failure in my NMI tests with augmenting debug information. Looks like a race condition:

From the job_dagman_fullremove.run script output: 

2012/12/28 18:23:35: <CondorTest> Abort event expected
2012/12/28 18:23:35: <CondorTest> $joblog = job_dagman_fullremove.log

FAILED
Not all dag nodes removed!
2012/12/28 18:23:35: <CondorTest> Child status was <<2304>>
The important thing here is that x_read_joblog completes its run at 18:23:35.

Now look at the Userlog from the run: 

009 (002.000.000) 12/28 18:23:23 Job was aborted by the user.
        removed because <OtherJobRemoveRequirements = DAGManJobId == 1> fired when job (1.0) was removed
...
009 (005.000.000) 12/28 18:23:30 Job was aborted by the user.
        removed because <OtherJobRemoveRequirements = DAGManJobId == 1> fired when job (1.0) was removed
...
009 (003.000.000) 12/28 18:23:34 Job was aborted by the user.
        removed because <OtherJobRemoveRequirements = DAGManJobId == 1> fired when job (1.0) was removed
...
009 (004.000.000) 12/28 18:23:36 Job was aborted by the user.
        removed because <OtherJobRemoveRequirements = DAGManJobId == 1> fired when job (1.0) was removed
...

Note that the shadow writes the abort event for cluster 4 at 18:23:36, after the x_read_joblog has completed its work. So the x_read_joblog never sees the abort event causing the test to report as FAIL, even though the test actually succeeds. Going to insert a sleep before running x_read_joblog to see if that helps.

2012-Dec-31 21:38:42 by nwp:
Pushed my fix onto master. I will monitor it to see if it fixes the problem consistently.

2013-Jan-07 15:49:23 by nwp:
Monitoring Batlab shows that this seems to fix the problem. Resolving.
